title: ğŸ¤–Big AI day at Google Cloud Next 2025
content:
GOOGLE
Image source: Google
The Rundown:
Google
announced
a flurry of AI news at its Google Cloud Next 2025 event, including a new agentic coding platform, next-gen AI chips, upgrades to its video, audio, and image models, a new Gemini 2.5 Flash model, and more.
The details:
Googleâ€™s Project IDX is
merging
with Firebase Studio, turning it into an agentic app development platform to compete with rivals like Cursor and Replit.
The company also
launched
Ironwood, its most powerful AI chip ever, offering massive improvements in performance and efficiency over previous designs.
Model
upgrades
include editing and camera control in Veo 2, the release of Lyria for text-to-music, and improved image creation and editing in Imagen 3.
Google also
released
Gemini 2.5 Flash, a faster and cheaper version of its top model that enables customizable reasoning levels for cost optimization.
Why it matters:
This quick summary doesnâ€™t do justice to the full breadth of announcements, with Googleâ€™s AI advances reaching across every aspect of the ecosystem. Between top models, advanced chips, and now its own competing IDE, Google continues to pack an absolutely massive punch with each new AI reveal.
rewrite:
### Google's AI Excitement: A Brief Synopsis

Greetings, esteemed colleagues! ğŸ“ Google's recent Cloud Next 2025 event was a veritable cornucopia of AI advancements, introducing a new agentic coding platform, state-of-the-art AI chips, and significant enhancements to video, audio, and image models, including the unveiling of the Gemini 2.5 Flash model. 

A notable development, Project IDX ğŸš€ is converging with Firebase Studio, transforming it into a formidable contender against rivals like Cursor and Replit in the realm of agentic app development. 

Google also launched Ironwood, an incredibly potent AI chip ğŸ§  that offers exponential performance and efficiency improvements over its predecessors.

Model upgrades ğŸ“ˆ include intuitive editing and camera control in Veo 2, the innovative Lyria for text-to-music conversion, and refined image creation and editing in Imagen 3. 

Moreover, the Gemini 2.5 Flash, a cost-effective version of its flagship model with customizable reasoning levels, was released. 

This cursory overview barely scratches the surface of Google's AI enhancements ğŸŒ. Their continual advancements across all aspects of the AI ecosystem are truly awe-inspiring. Google's commitment to pushing the boundaries of AI is palpable with each announcement.

title: ğŸ§©Solve the pricing puzzle for AI products
content:
TOGETHER WITH METRONOME
The Rundown:
Pricing an AI product right can often feel like solving a puzzle without the box cover. Join 49 Palms (ex-Simon Kucher, Author of Monetizing Innovation) and Metronome CEO Scott Woody to figure out how to build sustainable and effective pricing for AI.
In this session, you'll learn how to:
Apply a 9-step pricing framework
Monetize AIâ€“whether itâ€™s your core offering or an add-on
Treat pricing as a product and confidently run pricing experiments
Register now to save your spot
.
rewrite:
# TOGETHER WITH METRONOME ğŸ¤

Greetings, Scholars! The task of accurately pricing an AI product can often feel akin to tackling a jigsaw puzzle sans the box cover. ğŸ§© This next session, hosted by 49 Palms (feat. the former Simon Kucher, author of 'Monetizing Innovation') alongside Metronome's esteemed CEO, Scott Woody, aims to demystify this process. Together, we will explore how to construct sustainable and effective pricing strategies for AI.

In our discourse, you can expect to:

1. Familiarize yourself with a 9-step pricing framework ğŸ“‹
2. Learn how to effectively monetize AI, whether it's your core offering or an add-on ğŸ’°
3. Treat pricing as a product and confidently conduct pricing experiments ğŸ§ª

Get ready to expand your knowledge and understanding! Register now to secure your participation in this enlightening session. ğŸ“

title: ğŸ¤Googleâ€™s protocol for AI agent collaboration
content:
GOOGLE
Image source: â€¦
The Rundown:
Google
launched
Agent2Agent, a new open protocol that enables AI agents from different developers and frameworks to communicate and collaborate, with backing from 50+ tech and service giants, including Salesforce, SAP, and PayPal.
The details:
A2A enables agents to discover capabilities, manage tasks cooperatively, and exchange info across platformsâ€”even without sharing memory or context.
The protocol complements Anthropic's popular MCP, focusing on higher-level agent interactions while MCP handles interactions with external tools.
Launch partners include enterprise players like Atlassian, ServiceNow, and Workday, along with consulting firms like Accenture, Deloitte, and McKinsey.
The system also supports complex workflows like hiring, where multiple agents can do candidate sourcing and background checks without humans in the loop.
Why it matters:
AI agents are rapidly growing in capabilities, but unlocking their true capabilities will require a standard, streamlined way to interact with each other across platforms and frameworks. A2A could build on the success of MCP, helping build an interconnected system that allows multi-agent collaboration to tackle complex tasks.
rewrite:
## GOOGLE: Agent2Agent Protocol Launch ğŸš€ ![Image](...) 

Google has recently introduced Agent2Agent (A2A), an innovative open protocol that fosters communication and collaboration amongst AI agents from differing developers and frameworks. This ground-breaking endeavor has been supported by over 50 leading tech and service titans, encompassing Salesforce, SAP, and PayPal. 

The A2A protocol enables agents to discover capabilities, manage tasks collaboratively, and exchange information across multiple platforms without the necessity to share memory or context. This system complements Anthropic's prevalent MCP by focusing on higher-level agent interactions, while MCP concentrates on interactions with external tools. 

Renowned enterprise players such as Atlassian, ServiceNow, and Workday are among the launch partners, in addition to consulting powerhouses like Accenture, Deloitte, and McKinsey. A2A also facilitates complex workflows like hiring, allowing multiple AI agents to autonomously source candidates and conduct background checks.

AI agents' capabilities are expanding rapidly, but to fully unlock their potential, a standard, streamlined interaction method across platforms and frameworks is crucial. A2A could potentially build on MCP's success, constructing an interconnected system that promotes multi-agent collaboration for complex tasks. ğŸŒğŸ”—ğŸ¤–

title: ğŸ™ï¸Build your first AI voice assistant with Vapi
content:
AI TRAINING
The Rundown:
In this tutorial, you will learn how to use Vapi to create AI-powered voice assistants that handle phone calls naturally, with customizable voices and integration capabilities.
Step-by-step:
Head over to
Vapi
and create an assistant by either scratch or selecting a starting template.
Select your preferred AI model that will power your conversations and your desired transcriber for accurate speech recognition.
Choose a voice from Vapi's library or create your own voice clone.
Finally, add tools and integrations that let your assistant take in-call actions, like checking calendars, scheduling appointments, or transferring to human agents when needed.
Pro tip:
Focus on optimizing response latency (to under 1.5 seconds) for a natural conversation flow. We just did an extensive workshop on building AI Voice agents at
The Rundown University
, led by Jordan Dearsley, the Founder & CEO at Vapi.
rewrite:
# AI Training: A Tutorial on Vapi â˜ï¸ğŸ¤–
Greetings Scholars! Today, we delve into the fascinating world of AI-powered voice assistants courtesy of Vapi. This tool empowers you to design interactions that are as smooth and natural as human conversationğŸ‘¥. 

To begin your journey, navigate to Vapi and initiate the creation of an assistant. This can be from scratch or by selecting an available templateğŸ“‘. 

Next, select your preferred AI modelğŸ§ . This is the beating heart of your assistant, driving the conversations. Pair this with a transcriber to ensure stellar speech recognitionğŸ™ï¸. 

You then have the option to pick a voice from Vapi's library or even create your own unique cloneğŸ—£ï¸. 

Lastly, enhance your assistant's functionality by incorporating tools and integrations. This allows for actions such as checking calendarsğŸ“…, scheduling appointments, or even transferring to human agents if necessaryğŸ‘¥. 

A word of wisdom: aim to optimize response latency to under 1.5 seconds for a natural conversation flowâ±ï¸. For a deeper dive, I recommend The Rundown University's comprehensive workshop on building AI Voice agents, conducted by none other than Vapi's Founder & CEO, Jordan Dearsley.

title: ğŸ¤–Samsungâ€™s Gemini-powered Ballie home robot
content:
SAMSUNG & GOOGLE
Image source: Samsung
The Rundown:
Samsung and Google just
announced
a major partnership to launch Ballieâ€”a soccer ball-sized home robot teased for years at Samsungâ€™s CES eventsâ€”with Gemini AI models under the hood.
The details:
Ballie can roam homes autonomously on wheels, project videos on walls, control smart devices, and handle tasks through voice commands.
The robot will combine Gemini models with Samsung's own AI, delivering multimodal capabilities for voice, audio, and visual inputs.
It will launch in the U.S. and South Korea this summer, with plans for third-party app support also in the pipeline.
Ballie, first revealed at Samsungâ€™s CES event in 2020, has gone through several iterations over the years, but is only now getting an official release.
Why it matters:
The AI consumer robotics race is shaping up to be the next big tech frontier, and few are as well-positioned as Samsung to lead itâ€”leveraging their expansive SmartThings ecosystem and, now, the power of Googleâ€™s Gemini models to deliver truly â€˜smartâ€™ home robots that could redefine the category.
rewrite:
# SAMSUNG & GOOGLE: Presenting BallieğŸ¤– 
![Image source](https://www.samsung.com)
**Summary:**

Esteemed colleagues, SamsungğŸ“± and GoogleğŸ” have recently unveiled a significant collaboration; the launch of Ballie, an intriguing home robotğŸ ğŸ¤–, the size of a soccer ballâš½. Ballie has been a promising feature at Samsung's Consumer Electronics Show (CES) events for years. This innovative device is powered by Gemini AI models. 

Ballie can traverse homes independently on wheels, project videosğŸ¥ on walls, manage smart devicesğŸ“± and execute tasks through voice commandsğŸ™ï¸. The robot ingeniously integrates Gemini models with Samsung's proprietary AI, providing multimodal capabilities for voice, audio, and visual inputsğŸï¸ğŸ”‰ğŸ™ï¸.
